sense.name: a mistake during communication
sense.examples: The candidate is known for making slips of the tongue during his speeches. Another diplomatic slip such as that could lead to an escalation of the conflict. John regretted his slip of mentioning to Mary that he'd seen her boyfriend with Sally.

sense.name: physical skid or stumble
sense.examples: Pete banged up his knee from a slip on the ice. A single slip could send them plummeting down the mountainside.

sense.name: a measurable fall to a lower level
sense.examples: There has been a noticeable slip in home prices this year. Stocks continued their further slip into bear territory this week.

sense.name: dockside berth for a boat
sense.examples: Bob keeps his boat in a slip, rather than on a mooring. The marina charges $60 a night to rent a slip.

sense.name: a ramp for launching boats into the water
sense.examples: They backed the trailer with the motorboat down the slip into the water. Only canoes and kayaks may be launched from these slips.

sense.name: small narrow sheet of paper
sense.examples: The company is issuing pink slips next week. I wrote down John's phone number on a slip of paper.

sense.name: pillowcase
sense.examples: The maid changed the sheets and slips on the beds. These pillow slips are made of fine Egyptian cotton.

sense.name: a woman's chemise, undergarment
sense.examples: Mary told Sally that her slip was showing beneath her skirt. It's a glamour shot of the film star in a black, satin slip.

sense.name: calculated escape
sense.examples: The burglar gave the police the slip by going down a back alleyway. John's quiet slip past the door was in the hopes of avoiding Mary.

sense.name: a cutting from a plant for grafting or planting
sense.examples: Sally gave me some slips from her begonia. Put the impatiens slip in the water and it will grow roots.

sense.name: a slender young person
sense.examples: The violin prodigy was just a slip of a boy. Can such a slip of a girl handle such a big horse?

sense.name: tendency of motion against another surface
sense.examples: The helmsman felt the slip of the tiller. The buckle reduces the slip of the rope.

sense.name: sideways aerobatic maneuver
sense.examples: The pilot performed a slip in his biplane, then did a barrel roll.

sense.name: thinned potter's clay used for a coating
sense.examples: The potter applied a decorative slip to the ceramic plate.

sense.name: horizontal displacement along a fault line
sense.examples: After the earthquake, the slip had increased by two feet. The geology students measured the slips of several faults.

sense.name: a type of knitting stitch
sense.examples: Mary added decorative slips of different-colored yarn along the hem of the sweater.

sense.name: long flat strips of a material
sense.examples: John put slips of wood under the door to stop the cold air. Make small incisions in the leg of lamb and insert a slip of garlic into each one.
